Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an invoice.
Curator's comments: The character of this ostracon is not certain, owing to its brevity. It may conceivably be a receipt without a date; but it seems unlikely that receipts, except by an accident, would be issued without a date, and on the whole it is most probable that it was a note of the destination and, in most cases, nature and amount, of a consignment, sent with it as a check on full delivery.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.153)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87677) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87677)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 197 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
